oracle app details needed november pm re hi both currently link then select sign redirects connected then also app thanks senior november dear thank contacting kindly advise referring logging expense purchase requests which accessible credentials format sign screen right side referring app solely logging expense looking forward hearing thank much kind regards analyst ext history reference history additional comments visible update task task assignment assignee owner closed complete work notes description hi thanks senior more ref msg

message.reasoning:
**Categorizing IT tickets**

I need to classify an IT ticket from a user who provided a garbled text string. They want me to sort the ticket into one of several categories: Hardware, HR Support, Access, Miscellaneous, Storage, Purchase, Internal Project, or Administrative Rights. It’s essential to understand their request clearly so I can place it in the right category. Let’s see if I can decipher the content and make an appropriate classification!**Parsing the IT ticket**

I’m looking at a ticket with a jumbled message that seems related to Oracle app details. It mentions sign-in redirects, linked access, and logging expense purchase requests, along with credentials. This suggests it might center on access to the Oracle application or issues with authentication. I’ll need to clarify what specific help the user is seeking regarding the app and whether it pertains to credentials or general access issues. Let’s categorize this properly!**Categorizing the ticket**

I think the best category for this ticket is "Access," since it revolves around accessing the Oracle app, sign-in issues, and credentials. Although "Purchase" might fit because of the mention of "logging expense purchase requests," the primary focus is on access. The user needs help with the app and its credentials format. Now I just need to return a JSON object with the correct category format. Here it is: {"category":"Access"}.{"category":"Access"}
